meanings.definition: To cause to occur or operate at the same time or rate.
meanings.sent1: The dancers synced their movements perfectly with the music.
meanings.sent2: The audio and video were synced perfectly in the movie.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimmers synced their routine flawlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her heart synced with the rhythm of the drums.
meanings.sent5: The gears in the clock synced smoothly, ticking in unison.

meanings.sent1: He synced his steps with hers as they walked together.
meanings.sent2: The conductor synced the orchestra's performance with precision.
meanings.sent3: The traffic lights synced perfectly, causing no delays.
meanings.sent4: Their heartbeats synced as they gazed into each other's eyes.
meanings.sent5: The metronome synced perfectly with the music, keeping the tempo steady.

meanings.sent1: The team synced their efforts to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The colors of the painting synced beautifully, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimmers synced their outfits for a stunning visual effect.
meanings.sent4: Their voices synced in perfect harmony during the choir performance.
meanings.sent5: The different elements of the dish synced together to create a delicious flavor.
